}</script><script>if(window.mw){

"watchlisthideliu":0,"watchlisthideminor":0,"watchlisthideown":0,"watchlisthidepatrolled":0,"watchmoves":0,"wllimit":250,"useeditwarning":1,"prefershttps":1,"language":"en","variant-gan":"gan","variant-iu":"iu","variant-kk":"kk","variant-ku":"ku","variant-shi":"shi","variant-sr":"sr","variant-tg":"tg","variant-uz":"uz","variant-zh":"zh","searchNs0":true,"searchNs1":false,"searchNs2":false,"searchNs3":false,"searchNs4":false,"searchNs5":false,"searchNs6":false,"searchNs7":false,"searchNs8":false,"searchNs9":false,"searchNs10":false,"searchNs11":false,"searchNs12":false,"searchNs13":false,"searchNs14":false,"searchNs15":false,"variant":"en"});},{},{});mw.loader.implement("user.tokens",function(){mw.user.tokens.set({"editToken":"+\\","patrolToken":false,"watchToken":false});},{},{});

<!--[if lt IE 7]><style type="text/css">body{behavior:url("/w/skins/vector/csshover.min.htc")}</style><![endif]--></head>
<body class="mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr ns-0 ns-subject page-Paul_Walker skin-vector action-view vector-animateLayout">
		<div id="mw-page-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="mw-head-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="content" class="mw-body" role="main">
			<a id="top"></a>
			<div id="mw-js-message" style="display:none;"></div>
						<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><span dir="auto">Paul Walker</span></h1>
			<div id="bodyContent">
								<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-navigation">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Pp-protected&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Pp-protected (page does not exist)">Template:Pp-protected</a><div class="dablink">For other people named Paul Walker, see <a href="/w/index.php?title=Paul_Walker_(disambiguation)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Paul Walker (disambiguation) (page does not exist)">Paul Walker (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Use_American_English&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Use American English (page does not exist)">Template:Use American English</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Use_mdy_dates&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Use mdy dates (page does not exist)">Template:Use mdy dates</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Infobox_person&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Infobox person (page does not exist)">Template:Infobox person</a>
<b>Paul William Walker IV</b><sup id="cite_ref-WGN-Newsat9_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WGN-Newsat9-1">[1]</a></sup> (September 12, 1973 – November 30, 2013) was an American <a href="/w/index.php?title=Actor&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Actor (page does not exist)">actor</a>, model and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Philanthropist&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Philanthropist (page does not exist)">philanthropist</a>. Walker began his early career guest-starring in several <a href="/wiki/Television" title="Television">television</a> shows such as <i><a href="/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless" title="The Young and the Restless">The Young and the Restless</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Touched_By_An_Angel" title="Touched By An Angel" class="mw-redirect">Touched By An Angel</a></i>. He would then gain prominence with breakout roles in <a href="/wiki/Coming-of-age" title="Coming-of-age" class="mw-redirect">coming-of-age</a> and <a href="/w/index.php?title=Teen_films&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Teen films (page does not exist)">teen films</a> such as <i><a href="/wiki/She%27s_All_That" title="She's All That">She's All That</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Varsity_Blues_(film)" title="Varsity Blues (film)">Varsity Blues</a></i>. In 2001, Walker gained international fame for playing <a href="/w/index.php?title=Brian_O%27Conner&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brian O'Conner (page does not exist)">Brian O'Conner</a>, one of the lead <a href="/wiki/Protagonists" title="Protagonists" class="mw-redirect">protagonists</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Street_racing" title="Street racing">street racing</a> action film <i><a href="/wiki/The_Fast_and_the_Furious_(2001_film)" title="The Fast and the Furious (2001 film)"> The Fast and the Furious</a></i>, and would reprise the role in its additional <a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Fast_and_the_Furious&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Fast and the Furious (page does not exist)">sequels</a>. He also branched out in various films such as <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Eight_Below&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eight Below (page does not exist)">Eight Below</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Into_the_Blue_(2005_film)" title="Into the Blue (2005 film)">Into the Blue</a></i>, <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Joy_Ride_(2001_film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Joy Ride (2001 film) (page does not exist)">Joy Ride</a></i> and <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Takers&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Takers (page does not exist)">Takers</a></i>.
</p><p>Outside of acting, Walker was the face of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Coty,_Inc.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Coty, Inc. (page does not exist)">The Coty Prestige</a> <a href="/wiki/Fragrance" title="Fragrance" class="mw-redirect">fragrance</a> brand <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cool_Water_(perfume)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cool Water (perfume) (page does not exist)">Davidoff Cool Water for Men</a> and starred in the <a href="/wiki/National_Geographic_Channel" title="National Geographic Channel">National Geographic Channel</a> series, <i>Expedition Great White</i>. He also founded his own charity, <i>Reach Out Worldwide</i> (ROWW), an organization providing relief efforts for areas affected by <a href="/wiki/Natural_disasters" title="Natural disasters" class="mw-redirect">natural disasters</a>.  
</p><p>Walker died in a <a href="/w/index.php?title=Traffic_collision&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Traffic collision (page does not exist)">single car-accident</a> on November 30, 2013 alongside friend Roger Rodas. His film <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Hours_(2013_film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hours (2013 film) (page does not exist)">Hours</a></i> was released posthumously and his signature character, Brian O’Conner, will be retired in his final film <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Fast_%26_Furious_7&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fast &amp; Furious 7 (page does not exist)">Fast &amp; Furious 7</a></i>, which is slated to be released April 10, 2015.
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc"><div id="toctitle"><h2>Contents</h2></div>
<ul>

</ul>
</li>

<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-11"><a href="#External_links"><span class="tocnumber">8</span> <span class="toctext">External links</span></a></li>
</ul>
</div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life_and_education">Early life and education</span></h2>
<p>Walker, the son of Cheryl (née Crabtree), a fashion model, and Paul William Walker III, a sewer contractor and a fighter who was a two-time <a href="/wiki/Golden_Gloves" title="Golden Gloves">Golden Gloves</a> champion,<sup id="cite_ref-canoe.ca_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-canoe.ca-2">[2]</a></sup> was born in <a href="/wiki/Glendale,_California" title="Glendale, California">Glendale, California</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-famedive_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-famedive-3">[3]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">[4]</a></sup> His ancestry was mostly <a href="/w/index.php?title=English_American&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="English American (page does not exist)">English</a>, with a smaller amount of <a href="/wiki/German_American" title="German American">German</a>, and possibly <a href="/wiki/Irish_American" title="Irish American">Irish</a>. His paternal grandfather, a professional boxer, had English immigrant grandparents.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">[5]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">[7]</a></sup> One of his grandfathers raced factory cars for <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ford_Motor_Company&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Ford Motor Company (page does not exist)">Ford</a> in the 1960s.<sup id="cite_ref-canoe.ca_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-canoe.ca-2">[2]</a></sup> The oldest of five siblings, Walker was raised primarily in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Sunland-Tujunga,_Los_Angeles&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Sunland-Tujunga, Los Angeles (page does not exist)">Sunland</a> community of <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles" title="Los Angeles">Los Angeles</a> and attended high school in the <a href="/wiki/San_Fernando_Valley" title="San Fernando Valley">San Fernando Valley</a>, graduating from <a href="/wiki/Sun_Valley,_Los_Angeles" title="Sun Valley, Los Angeles">Sun Valley</a>'s <a href="/w/index.php?title=Village_Christian_Schools&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Village Christian Schools (page does not exist)">Village Christian School</a> in 1991.<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-gazzar_9-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-gazzar-9">[9]</a></sup> He was raised as a member of <a href="/wiki/The_Church_of_Jesus_Christ_of_Latter-day_Saints" title="The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints">the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-famedive_3-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-famedive-3">[3]</a></sup>  After high school, Walker attended several community colleges in <a href="/wiki/Southern_California" title="Southern California">Southern California</a>, majoring in <a href="/wiki/Marine_biology" title="Marine biology">marine biology</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Tribute_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Tribute-10">[10]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Career">Career</span></h2>
<p>Walker began his small screen career as a toddler, when he starred in a television commercial for <a href="/wiki/Pampers" title="Pampers">Pampers</a>. He began modeling at the age of two and began working on television shows in 1985, with roles in shows such as <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Highway_to_Heaven&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Highway to Heaven (page does not exist)">Highway to Heaven</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Who%27s_the_Boss%3F" title="Who's the Boss?">Who's the Boss?</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless" title="The Young and the Restless">The Young and the Restless</a></i>, and <i><a href="/wiki/Touched_by_an_Angel" title="Touched by an Angel">Touched by an Angel</a></i>. That same year, he starred in a commercial for <a href="/wiki/Showbiz_Pizza" title="Showbiz Pizza" class="mw-redirect">Showbiz Pizza</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">[11]</a></sup> Walker's film career began in 1986, with the <a href="/wiki/Horror_film" title="Horror film">horror</a>/<a href="/wiki/Comedy_film" title="Comedy film">comedy film</a> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Monster_in_the_Closet&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Monster in the Closet (page does not exist)">Monster in the Closet</a></i>. He and his sister Ashlie were contestants on a 1988 episode of the game show <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=I%27m_Telling!&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="I'm Telling! (page does not exist)">I'm Telling!</a></i>; they finished in second place. In 1993 he played Brandon Collins on the CBS soap opera <i><a href="/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless" title="The Young and the Restless">The Young and the Restless</a></i>. He and his co-star <a href="/wiki/Heather_Tom" title="Heather Tom">Heather Tom</a>, who played Victoria Newman, were nominated for Outstanding Lead Actor and Actress in a soap opera at the Youth in Film Awards.  In 1998, Walker made his feature film debut in the comedy <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Meet_the_Deedles&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Meet the Deedles (page does not exist)">Meet the Deedles</a></i>, which finally gained him fame. This subsequently led to <a href="/wiki/Supporting_actor" title="Supporting actor">supporting</a> roles in the movies <i><a href="/wiki/Pleasantville_(film)" title="Pleasantville (film)">Pleasantville</a></i> (1998), <i><a href="/wiki/Varsity_Blues_(film)" title="Varsity Blues (film)">Varsity Blues</a></i> (1999), <i><a href="/wiki/She%27s_All_That" title="She's All That">She's All That</a></i> (1999), and <i><a href="/wiki/The_Skulls_(film)" title="The Skulls (film)">The Skulls</a></i> (2000).
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:132px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Paul_Walker.jpg" title="File:Paul Walker.jpg">File:Paul Walker.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Walker at a convention in February 2006</div></div></div>
<p>In 2001, Walker's breakthrough role arrived when he starred opposite actor <a href="/wiki/Vin_Diesel" title="Vin Diesel">Vin Diesel</a> in the successful <a href="/wiki/Action_film" title="Action film">action</a> film <i><a href="/wiki/The_Fast_and_the_Furious_(2001_film)" title="The Fast and the Furious (2001 film)">The Fast and the Furious</a></i>, the first film in the franchise. The film established Walker as a notable film star and leading man and led to his reprisal of the role in the 2003 sequel <i><a href="/wiki/2_Fast_2_Furious" title="2 Fast 2 Furious">2 Fast 2 Furious</a></i>. He continued his career with leading roles in films such as <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Joy_Ride_(2001_film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Joy Ride (2001 film) (page does not exist)">Joy Ride</a></i> (2001), <i><a href="/wiki/Into_the_Blue_(2005_film)" title="Into the Blue (2005 film)">Into the Blue</a></i> (2005), and <i><a href="/wiki/Timeline_(film)" title="Timeline (film)">Timeline</a></i> (2003); he had a supporting role in <a href="/wiki/Clint_Eastwood" title="Clint Eastwood">Clint Eastwood</a>'s adaptation of <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Flags_of_Our_Fathers_(film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Flags of Our Fathers (film) (page does not exist)">Flags of Our Fathers</a></i> (2006).
</p><p>Walker then starred in the crime <a href="/wiki/Thriller_(genre)" title="Thriller (genre)">thriller</a> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Running_Scared_(2006_film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Running Scared (2006 film) (page does not exist)">Running Scared</a></i> and <a href="/wiki/Walt_Disney_Pictures" title="Walt Disney Pictures">Walt Disney Pictures</a>' <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Eight_Below&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Eight Below (page does not exist)">Eight Below</a></i>, both released in 2006. <i>Eight Below</i> garnered critical-acclaim and opened in first place at the box office, grossing over US$20&#160;million during its first weekend.<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">[12]</a></sup> During the filming of <i>Running Scared</i>, director <a href="/w/index.php?title=Wayne_Kramer_(filmmaker)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Wayne Kramer (filmmaker) (page does not exist)">Wayne Kramer</a> stated that "[Walker] is that guy on some level"<sup id="cite_ref-Kramer_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kramer-13">[13]</a></sup> when comparing Walker with his character in the movie, Joey Gazelle. Kramer continued on to say that he "loved working with [Walker] because as a director he's completely supportive of my vision of what the film is. And even better, he's completely game for it."<sup id="cite_ref-Kramer_13-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Kramer-13">[13]</a></sup>
</p><p>Walker starred in the independent film <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Lazarus_Project&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Lazarus Project (page does not exist)">The Lazarus Project</a></i>, which was released on DVD on October 21, 2008. He subsequently returned to <i>The Fast and the Furious</i> <a href="/w/index.php?title=The_Fast_and_the_Furious_(film_series)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="The Fast and the Furious (film series) (page does not exist)">franchise</a>, reprising his role in <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Fast_%26_Furious&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fast &amp; Furious (page does not exist)">Fast &amp; Furious</a></i>, which was released on April 3, 2009.<sup id="cite_ref-Apple_14-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Apple-14">[14]</a></sup> Walker then appeared in the <a href="/wiki/Crime_film" title="Crime film">crime</a> <a href="/wiki/Drama_film" title="Drama film">drama</a> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Takers&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Takers (page does not exist)">Takers</a></i>, which began filming in early September 2008 and was released in August 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-BoneDeep_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BoneDeep-15">[15]</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a href="/w/index.php?title=Coty,_Inc.&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Coty, Inc. (page does not exist)">Coty Prestige</a> <a href="/wiki/Fragrance" title="Fragrance" class="mw-redirect">fragrance</a> brand <a href="/w/index.php?title=Cool_Water_(perfume)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Cool Water (perfume) (page does not exist)">Davidoff Cool Water for Men</a> announced in January 2011 that Walker was going to be the new face of the brand as of July 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">[16]</a></sup> He reprised his role in the fifth installment of <i>The Fast and the Furious</i> series, <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Fast_Five&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fast Five (page does not exist)">Fast Five</a></i> (2011), and again in <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Fast_%26_Furious_6&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fast &amp; Furious 6 (page does not exist)">Fast &amp; Furious 6</a></i> (2013). 
</p><p>Shortly after Walker's death, <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Hours_(2013_film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Hours (2013 film) (page does not exist)">Hours</a></i>, which he had completed earlier in 2013, was released on December 13, 2013. Another completed film, <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Brick_Mansions&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brick Mansions (page does not exist)">Brick Mansions</a></i>, is set for release in May 2014. At the time of his death, Walker had been filming <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Fast_%26_Furious_7&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fast &amp; Furious 7 (page does not exist)">Fast &amp; Furious 7</a></i>, which was slated for release in July 2014. The film will now be completed and release in April 2015 by writing out Walker's character in the film's remaining scenes. <sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">[17]</a></sup> He was also set to play <a href="/wiki/Agent_47" title="Agent 47">Agent 47</a> in the <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Agent_47_(film)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Agent 47 (film) (page does not exist)">Hitman</a></i> film adaptation but died before production began.<sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Personal_life">Personal life</span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Tyrese_Gibson_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg" title="File:Tyrese Gibson by Gage Skidmore.jpg">File:Tyrese Gibson by Gage Skidmore.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Paul Walker shared a close friendship with Tyrese Gibson</div></div></div>
<p>Walker lived in <a href="/wiki/Santa_Barbara,_California" title="Santa Barbara, California">Santa Barbara</a> with his dogs.<sup id="cite_ref-famedive_3-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-famedive-3">[3]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-OC_19-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OC-19">[19]</a></sup> He and Rebecca Soteros,<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">[20]</a></sup> a one-time girlfriend, have a daughter named Meadow,<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">[21]</a></sup> who lived with her mother in Hawaii for 13 years and then moved to California to live with Walker in 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">[22]</a></sup> He held a brown belt in <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_jiu-jitsu" title="Brazilian jiu-jitsu">Brazilian jiu-jitsu</a> under Ricardo "Franjinha" Miller at Paragon Jiu-Jitsu<sup id="cite_ref-MensHealth_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-MensHealth-23">[23]</a></sup> and was awarded with his black belt by Miller posthumously.<sup id="cite_ref-bjpenn_24-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-bjpenn-24">[24]</a></sup>
</p><p>Walker's first passion was <a href="/wiki/Marine_biology" title="Marine biology">marine biology</a>; he joined the Board of Directors of The Billfish Foundation in 2006.<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">[25]</a></sup> He fulfilled a lifelong dream by starring in a <a href="/wiki/National_Geographic_Channel" title="National Geographic Channel">National Geographic Channel</a> series <i>Expedition Great White</i> (later retitled <i>Shark Men</i>), which premiered in June 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-starp_26-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-starp-26">[26]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-diverw_27-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-diverw-27">[27]</a></sup> He spent 11 days as part of the crew, catching and tagging 7 <a href="/wiki/Great_white_shark" title="Great white shark">great white sharks</a> off the coast of Mexico. The expedition, led by Chris Fischer, founder and CEO of Fischer Productions, along with Captain Brett McBride and Dr. Michael Domeier of the Marine Conservation Science Institute took measurements, gathered DNA samples, and fastened real-time satellite tags to the great white sharks. This allowed Dr. Domeier to study migratory patterns especially those associated with mating and birthing over a 5-year period of time.<sup id="cite_ref-natgeo_28-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-natgeo-28">[28]</a></sup>
</p><p>In March 2010, Walker went to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Constituci%C3%B3n,_Chile&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Constitución, Chile (page does not exist)">Constitución, Chile</a> to offer his help and support to the people injured in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2010_Chile_earthquake&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2010 Chile earthquake (page does not exist)">8.8 magnitude earthquake</a> that struck on February 27. He flew with his <a href="/wiki/Humanitarian_aid" title="Humanitarian aid">humanitarian aid</a> team, Reach Out Worldwide, to Haiti to lend a helping hand to the <a href="/w/index.php?title=2010_Haiti_earthquake&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="2010 Haiti earthquake (page does not exist)">2010 Haiti earthquake</a> victims.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">[29]</a></sup>
</p><p>An avid car enthusiast, he competed in the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Redline_Time_Attack&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Redline Time Attack (page does not exist)">Redline Time Attack</a> racing series in which he raced an <a href="/wiki/BMW_M3" title="BMW M3">M3 E92</a> and was on the AE Performance Team. His car was sponsored by Etnies, Brembo Brakes, Ohlins, Volk, OS Giken, Hankook, Gintani, and Reach Out Worldwide.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">[30]</a></sup> Walker had been preparing for an <a href="/wiki/Auto_show" title="Auto show">auto show</a> prior to his death.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31">[31]</a></sup>
</p><p>Roger Rodas became Walker's financial adviser in 2007 and helped to establish Reach Out Worldwide.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">[32]</a></sup> Rodas was the CEO of Always Evolving, a Valencia high-end vehicle performance shop owned by Walker.<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">[33]</a></sup> Walker shared a close friendship with his <i>The Fast and the Furious</i> co-star <a href="/w/index.php?title=Tyrese_Gibson&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Tyrese Gibson (page does not exist)">Tyrese Gibson</a>, who was his best friend.<sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">[34]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35">[35]</a></sup>
<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">[36]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Death">Death</span></h2>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Nissan_Skyline_-_2_Fast_2_Furious.JPG" title="File:Nissan Skyline - 2 Fast 2 Furious.JPG">File:Nissan Skyline - 2 Fast 2 Furious.JPG</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Walker drove a <a href="/wiki/Nissan_Skyline_GT-R" title="Nissan Skyline GT-R">Nissan Skyline GT-R</a> in <i><a href="/wiki/2_Fast_2_Furious" title="2 Fast 2 Furious">2 Fast 2 Furious</a></i>.</div></div></div>
<p>On November 30, 2013, at approximately 3:30 p.m. <a href="/wiki/Pacific_Time_Zone" title="Pacific Time Zone">PST</a>, Walker and friend Roger Rodas, age 38, a former professional racer and who worked as Walker's financial adviser<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">[37]</a></sup> left an event for Walker's charity Reach Out Worldwide for victims of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Typhoon_Haiyan&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Typhoon Haiyan (page does not exist)">Typhoon Haiyan</a><sup id="cite_ref-CNN1_38-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CNN1-38">[38]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">[39]</a></sup> in Rodas' red 2005 <a href="/wiki/Porsche_Carrera_GT" title="Porsche Carrera GT">Porsche Carrera GT</a>. The car crashed into a concrete light pole and two trees on Hercules Street, a 45&#160;mph speed zone near Kelly Johnson Parkway in <a href="/w/index.php?title=Valencia,_Santa_Clarita,_California&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Valencia, Santa Clarita, California (page does not exist)">Valencia, Santa Clarita, California</a>, after which the vehicle burst into flames.<sup id="cite_ref-CNN1_38-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CNN1-38">[38]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40">[40]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-TIME1_41-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TIME1-41">[41]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42">[42]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">[43]</a></sup> Authorities determined that Rodas was driving the car, while Walker was the passenger.<sup id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-44">[44]</a></sup> The Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department declared both victims dead at the scene.<sup id="cite_ref-TIME1_41-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TIME1-41">[41]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BBC_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBC-45">[45]</a></sup> Rodas died of multiple traumatic injuries, while Walker died from the combined effects of traumatic and thermal injuries, according to the <a href="/w/index.php?title=Los_Angeles_County_Coroner&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Los Angeles County Coroner (page does not exist)">Los Angeles county coroner's office</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_44-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-44">[44]</a></sup>
</p><p>The curve where Walker and Rodas were killed is a popular spot for <a href="/wiki/Drifting_(motorsport)" title="Drifting (motorsport)">drifting</a> cars.<sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">[46]</a></sup> The coroner’s report stated that the 2005 Porsche Carrera GT may have been traveling at speeds up to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Convert&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Convert (page does not exist)">Template:Convert</a> before the crash. The coroner's report further stated that no alcohol or drugs were found in the systems of either man.<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-47">[47]</a></sup> Furthermore, it states that there were no hints on technical problems with the car and neither a damaged surface of the street nor parts on the street played a role in the accident.<sup id="cite_ref-48" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-48">[48]</a></sup> Police investigated as to whether <a href="/wiki/Drag_racing" title="Drag racing">drag racing</a> played a role, but were unable to find evidence of a second car's involvement.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-49">[49]</a></sup> Walker's family claims that reflectors on the road may have contributed to the crash, claiming this particular kind of Porsche would lose control if it comes into contact with even the tiniest bumps in the road at high speeds.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50">[50]</a></sup> A piece of the car was stolen off the tow truck as the wreckage was towed away on a flatbed. Two men were arrested for grand theft.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51">[51]</a></sup>
</p><p>With <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Fast_%26_Furious_7&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fast &amp; Furious 7 (page does not exist)">Fast &amp; Furious 7</a></i> in the middle of filming at the time of Walker's death, Universal announced an indeterminate hiatus on the production, citing a desire to speak with his family before determining what to do with the film.<sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-52">[52]</a></sup>
His brother, Cody Walker, was asked to be the stand-in to complete this film.<sup id="cite_ref-ixzz2nXDreU3H_53-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ixzz2nXDreU3H-53">[53]</a></sup>
Numerous friends and movie stars have posted tributes to Walker on social media.<sup id="cite_ref-nzherald_54-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-nzherald-54">[54]</a></sup> Two weeks after his death, Walker's ashes were buried in a non-denominational ceremony at the <a href="/wiki/Forest_Lawn_Memorial_Park_(Hollywood_Hills)" title="Forest Lawn Memorial Park (Hollywood Hills)">Forest Lawn Memorial Park</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55">[55]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Filmography">Filmography</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Film">Film</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Fast_Five_Cast_2.jpg" title="File:Fast Five Cast 2.jpg">File:Fast Five Cast 2.jpg</a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><i>Fast Five</i> cast with <a href="/wiki/Natalie_Morales" title="Natalie Morales">Natalie Morales</a> for <a href="/wiki/NBC" title="NBC">NBC</a>'s <i><a href="/wiki/Today_(U.S._TV_program)" title="Today (U.S. TV program)">Today Show</a></i>.</div></div></div>

<tr>
<td>2013
</td>
<td> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Vehicle_19&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Vehicle 19 (page does not exist)">Vehicle 19</a></i>
</td>
<td> Michael Woods
</td>
<td>
</td></tr>
<tr>
<td> 2013
</td>
<td> <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Fast_%26_Furious_6&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Fast &amp; Furious 6 (page does not exist)">Fast &amp; Furious 6</a></i>
</td>
<td> <a href="/w/index.php?title=Brian_O%27Conner&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Brian O'Conner (page does not exist)">Brian O'Conner</a>
</td>
<td>

<tr>
<td> 2013

<td> Had not finished filming his scenes at time of death. Last Film

		</ul>
	</div>
